person.persName: Thomas Johnson (Provisional Congress of the Confederate States)

body.p: A Kentucky farmer, trader, soldier, and politician. Educated in the common schools. Worked as a farmer and livestock trader in Montgomery County, Kentucky and with southern markets. Owned a large swath of land in the South involved in the production of cotton. Married to Elizabeth Peters Johnson. Father of Albert Sidney Johnson, Pattie Johnson Riley, Annie Johnson Goodpaster, Susette Johnson, and two other daughters. Owned six enslaved persons in 1850 and eleven in 1860. Served in the Kentucky State Militia, attaining the rank of major general. Served as a member of the Provisional Congress of the Confederate States in the winter of 1861 and 1862 for six weeks. Served as a major and lieutenant colonel with the Second Battalion Kentucky Mounted Rifles from 1862 to 1865. Returned to Mount Sterling, Kentucky to his profession.
